Class PhoneController

java.lang.Object
com.webServiceSpring.WebService.controller.PhoneController
@RestController public class PhoneController extends Object
Mehmet Bengican Altunsu, Yusuf GÃ¶kberk KeptiÄŸ This class is the controller of Phone Entity. Any requests to modify or get Phones goes through this controller.

  • Method Details

    • addPhone

      @PostMapping("/addPhone") public void addPhone​(@RequestBody PhoneHandler phoneHandler)
      This method adds a Phone to the phone table.
      Parameters:
      phoneHandler - which holds a phone temporarily to handle Json formats.
      See Also:
      HTTP POST Request You can use this method by posting a JSON body that includes variables of the PhoneHandler class. Example Request: url/addPhone

    • getPhoneByBrand

      @GetMapping("/getPhoneByBrand/{brand}") public List<PhoneHandler> getPhoneByBrand​(@PathVariable String brand)
      This methods gets all phone from a particular brand.
      Parameters:
      brand - a String representing a Brand.
      Returns:
      List
      See Also:
      Brand, HTTP GET Request Example Request: url/getPhoneByBrand/Samsung

    • getPhoneByCriteria

      @GetMapping("/getPhoneByCriteria") public List<PhoneHandler> getPhoneByCriteria​(@RequestParam(value="brandName",required=false) String brand, @RequestParam(value="model",required=false) String model, @RequestParam(value="internalMem",required=false) Integer internalMemory, @RequestParam(value="screenSizeString",required=false) String screenSizeString, @RequestParam(value="internalMemString",required=false) String internalMemString)
      Parameters:
      brand - A string representing brand name
      model - A string representing model of the product.
      internalMemory - An integer representing the storage capacity of the phone.
      screenSizeString - A string representing the screen size type of the phone(Large Screen,Small Screen etc.)
      internalMemString - A string representing the internal memory type of the phone(Large Memory, Small Memory etc.)
      Returns:
      List
      See Also:
      HTTP GET Request Example Request: url/getPhoneByCriteria?brandName=Samsung=17.3 You can use any attribute of a phone as a parameter for criteria.

    • getPhones

      @GetMapping("/getPhones") public List<PhoneHandler> getPhones()
      This methods gets all Phones from the Phone table.
      Returns:
      List
      See Also:
      HTTP GET Request Example Request: url/getPhones

    • getPhone

      @GetMapping("/getPhone/{id}") public PhoneHandler getPhone​(@PathVariable int id)
      This methods gets a Phone given a phone id from the Phone table.
      Parameters:
      id - An integer representing the phone id.
      Returns:
      PhoneHandler
      See Also:
      HTTP GET Request Example Request: url/getPhone/3

    • deletePhone

      @DeleteMapping("/deletePhone/{id}") public void deletePhone​(@PathVariable int id)
      This methods deletes a Phone given a phone id.
      Parameters:
      id - An integer representing the phone id. HTTP DELETE Request Example Request: url/deletePhone/3
